thread.title: Disney holiday accommodation

author: The Telegraph
title: Disney holiday accommodation
text: Whether it is a stateroom on a Disney cruise ship or resort within Walt Disney World in Florida, there are amazing accommodation options to suit every family, no matter what its size or needs. When you’re looking for a home away from home, it is great to know you can count on the Disney quality of service (imagine the resorts as your own personal fairy godmother), amazing facilities and attention to detail to make every moment of your holiday special. With gracious staff on hand to make your stay magical and memorable, the hardest part of your holiday is deciding between more than 25 resort hotels At Walt Disney World, your accommodation is located right in the heart of the magic, meaning you can pop back from the parks to splash in the pool whenever you want, safe in the knowledge you can head back to the parks with ease. And there are options to suit every budget, with Value, Moderate, Deluxe and Deluxe Villa options, all themed to fit in with the character of each resort. Enjoy the numerous benefits of staying on-site, such as free resort transport to the parks by bus, boat or monorail and Extra Magic Hours that allow up to two hours’ additional park time on selected days. You can even sign up to one of three dining plans to suit your budget and family’s needs as well as enjoying the freedom of the colourful MagicBands which do everything from opening hotel room doors to allowing access to the parks and paying for food and merchandise. Home from home: a Lion King Suite in Disney's Art of Animation Resort Other special experiences include stories around a campfire at Disney’s Animal Kingdom and toasting marshmallows on the beach at Disney’s Polynesian Resort. Why not dance to your own beat with a stay at the value All-Star Music Resort – complete with guitar-shaped pool – or at Disney’s Coronado Springs Resort, the lakeside Mexican-inspired resort serves a moderate price point with affordable standard rooms and more luxurious king suites for extended families. With gracious staff on hand to make your stay magical and memorable, the hardest part of your holiday is deciding between more than 25 resort hotels. Disney’s Pop Century Resort is a popular favourite with families looking for great value and added extras such as the Sixties-style Hippy Dippy Pool, where Movies Under The Stars are screened for everyone to enjoy. Disney’s Caribbean Beach Resort is a moderate option and offers both a beach break and grander accommodations for those looking for a tropical time. Enjoy an Out-of-Africa experience at the deluxe Animal Kingdom Lodge, with the option of having a savannah view room, which make up one of the six lands that are home to more than 1,700 animals. The Grand Floridian is another sumptuous deluxe option, with its Victorian elegance, white-sand beach and proximity to the Magic Kingdom (you can even see the fireworks light up the night sky over Cinderella’s Castle). Families looking for a luxurious home away from home can opt for the deluxe villas. Disney’s Polynesian Villas & Bungalows feature modern luxury combined with whimsical touches to transport guests to a beautiful Polynesian paradise at one of Walt Disney World Resort’s original and most popular places to stay. A good night's sleep: why not choose a Deluxe oceanview stateroom? Disney’s dedication to creating amazing accommodation continues at sea, where staterooms have been designed to create as much space as possible for families, with plenty of storage. Unsurpassed personal attention from Disney’s staff means that your preferences will be tailored to your needs, from customised in-room service to a friendly smile from your steward as they go the extra mile to make your stay outstanding. The Disney difference continues in the thoughtful touches that help create magical memories of unforgettable journeys. Charming vintage Art Deco design details will please mum and dad and whimsical “towelgami” towel animals in the room at night will delight the children. Each stateroom, from cosy private spaces to grand suites, features extra room for relaxation and means families big and small can enjoy superior comfort at sea. The options available cater to every family, from standard and deluxe inside staterooms to oceanview staterooms with balconies and even luxurious suites. On some Disney Ships you can add a sprinkling of Disney magic to an inside stateroom by opting for one with a magic porthole offering “views” of the seascape outside (and even a few passing friends). Whatever your budget or interest, there is a special place to stay where the family can truly live the magic of a Disney experience.
